content.prompt: Which of the following was one technique employed by Paleolithic artists at the Great Hall of the Bulls at Lascaux to create the clear lines of the animalsâ€™ forms?

choices.label: Using pens made from hollow animal bones filled with pigment to draw precise outlines
Using hands as stencils while blowing pigments to spray a surface
Using leather cut into shapes and soaked in pigment to print forms onto the wall
Using fingers dipped in fat from oil lamps to create wax contour lines

topic.text: 1.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Prehistoric Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
